citations.narrative:
Statements from facility staff and a veterinary record indicate that a keeper left open a gate to the outdoor enclosure
housing 2 adult Stanley Cranes on 05 March 2025. Facility representatives state the birds are pinioned to prevent flying
away. That day, one of the birds was found deceased in front of the striped hyena enclosure located across a public
access pathway from the bird enclosure. A necropsy report shows that the head, upper neck area and left leg were
missing from the animal. Facility representatives state the bird likely walked out of its primary enclosure through the open
gate, arrived in front of the hyena enclosure and was attacked through the fence, causing its death. Failure to ensure an
animal is adequately secured during husbandry and handling activity can result in their severe injury or death. Handling of
all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, behavioral
stress, physical harm or unnecessary discomfort.
Correct from this date forward of 28 April 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Tamila Stott, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
